content: <glamperd> > <glamperd>  The computation part is a subset of the full Groth16 PPoT. The main consideration to my mind is the output data structure. With snarkjs, we get a file format that's widely used, has the transcript baked in, and anyone can run the verification command with readily available software. The drawback is it's Groth16. We can live with that to get started. I think it'd be good if we could work with iden3 to get a KZG release of snarkjs. (re @trent_vanepps: when i spoke with @glamperd last week he said that kev's work deviated from the ppot construction, i think he said something like "snark-js bindings would be different" which would result in more work to get both approaches to parity (geoff please correct me if i'm wrong!))
